image.altText: A football player with long dark hair wearing a green jersey, surrounded by players from another team, looks over his shoulder.

props.synopsis: Charges against Canberra Raiders prop Josh Papalii have been permanently stayed after it was revealed police had been discussing the case in a group chat on encrypted messaging service Signal.

title.children: Police group chat stops case against Canberra Raiders star Josh Papalii

image.altText: Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory

props.synopsis: After a severe car accident, the victim spent a year recovering in hospital. Then one day he discovered his bank account was empty.

title.children: Man sentenced after emptying quadriplegic friend's bank account

image.altText: An older couple, smiling, sitting on a couch, with arms around one another.

props.synopsis: Specialised accommodation will be built in Curtin to house those living with the nation's deadliest disease.

title.children: Canberra is a step closer to getting its first dementia care village

image.altText: A lawyer in a suit talking to media.

props.synopsis: Survivors and lawyers welcome the nation-leading legislation, with legal action against churches, sporting groups and others to be affected.

title.children: ACT closes 'legal loophole' making institutions more liable for child sexual abuse

image.altText: An old photo of a young boy in school uniform.

props.synopsis: Survivors watched on as the ACT took a historic step on Tuesday in passing a bill to overturn a High Court decision that allowed a church to avoid litigation over the actions of one of its priests.

title.children: ACT becomes the mouse that roared in helping survivors fight for justice

image.altText: A bus and a politician

props.synopsis: Investigators and users say the ACT government's MyWay+ project was rushed and flawed.

title.children: Minister censured over 'user-hateful' public transport upgrades

image.altText: Man in suit and sunglasses beside a woman in a suit jacket and pink shirt wearing sunglasses.

props.synopsis: A woman who used credit cards from the childcare centre where she worked to purchase personal clothes and cosmetics has been sentenced to jail.

title.children: Woman jailed for $300,000 childcare centre fraud

image.altText: A Virgin plan on the tarmac.

props.synopsis: A man who drove through the airport's perimeter fence three times in 2023 has been sentenced in the ACT Supreme Court.

title.children: Man jailed over theft of Virgin van driven on Canberra Airport tarmac

image.altText: ACT Liberals leader Leanne Castley

props.synopsis: When approached by the ABC this morning, Canberra Liberals leader Leanne Castley would not provide an explanation for why two backbenchers were removed from the party room but insisted they were allowed to cross the floor.

title.children: Castley refuses to explain why backbenchers removed from party room

image.altText: Banner protesting wind farm proposals

props.synopsis: There are grave concerns that dangerous language and bullying of farmers who are hosting renewable energy projects on their properties could turn into violence.

title.children: 'It's gotten out of hand': Wind farmers fear threat to turn to violence

image.altText: A man in a black suit flanked by security guards exits a prison van and enters the Supreme Court of Victoria.

props.synopsis: Greg Lynn's lawyer says the prosecution "played outside the rules" during the former Jetstar pilot's double-murder trial last year as he appeals his conviction and sentence.

title.children: Greg Lynn faces court in bid to quash High Country murder conviction

image.altText: dan tehan

props.synopsis: After most federal Liberal MPs attended a net zero meeting in Canberra, there is cautious optimism a consensus position can be found, but the junior Coalition partner could be poised to strike first.

title.children: Liberals seek unity on net zero but fear Nationals will dump target first

image.altText: Former Port Adelaide footballer Warren Tredrea at Alberton Oval.

props.synopsis: AFL great Warren Tredrea has been dismissed from the board of the Port Adelaide Football Club, the Power has confirmed.

title.children: Port Adelaide dismisses Warren Tredrea from board of directors

image.altText: A coal-fired power station on an overcast day

props.synopsis: AGL is preparing to shed hundreds jobs as part of a massive restructure aimed at freeing up capital to accelerate its transition away from coal and towards renewables.

title.children: AGL to shed hundreds of coal jobs and accelerate green transition

image.altText: Hands beside a dinosaur footprint.

props.synopsis: From dinosaur footprints to volcanic eruptions, First Nations knowledge is helping to drive modern science.

title.children: Song cycle led scientists to hidden dinosaur tracks

image.altText: A blurred photo of a doctor's waiting room with a sign on the top that says 'We are a medicare bulk billing practice'

props.synopsis: The government is pouring billions into Medicare so you have a better chance of being bulk-billed but the decision to charge or not charge still rests completely with your doctor.

title.children: Bulk-billing changes start tomorrow — here's what it means for you

image.altText: more than a dozen villagers in casual clothes standing in mud holding staffs, some digging amid jungle

props.synopsis: Police say 21 people have been killed in a landslide in Papua New Guinea's highlands overnight, with bodies still being recovered.

title.children: Houses flattened after landslide strikes Papua New Guinean village

image.altText: homemade chilli paste collage

props.synopsis: Queensland Health says the three products were made in a home kitchen and were either gifted or purchased in the local area.

title.children: Homemade food items confirmed as rat poisoning source, sixth case identified

image.altText: Andrew Bolt in a suit and tie at a desk in a TV studio, looking into camera.

props.synopsis: Senior managers at the National Broadband Network intervened to accelerate a home internet upgrade for News Corp pundit Andrew Bolt and resolve a technical problem for a top executive's friend during the final stages of the infrastructure project's rollout.

title.children: 'Throw the kitchen sink at it': NBN Co fast-tracked upgrade for Bolt

image.altText: A woman with a shaved head and floral dress sits at a table.

props.synopsis: Yorgos Lanthimos continues his journey as the king of absurdist dark comedies with this latest offering, which delves into conspiracy theories in the most bizarre way.

title.children: Emma Stone shaved her head for Bugonia, but that's just the beginning

image.altText: A grey-haired, middle-aged man in a dark suit.

props.synopsis: A debate is underway about American democracy, as California's governor campaigns for voters to approve a set of gerrymandered maps.

title.children: 'Race to the bottom': Democrats gerrymander as US democracy strains

image.altText: A healthcare worker giving a Band-Aid to a young Indigenous child.

props.synopsis: Imagine visiting a health clinic where you may be exposed to asbestos, leaking roofs and lead in the water pipes. That's the reality for remote NT, according to a new report.

title.children: Asbestos, lead, a leaky roof: The state of healthcare in remote NT

image.altText: Alex and Tony take a selfie

props.synopsis: Having recently ended a seven-year long-distance relationship, Alex Bowyer wasn't keen on repeating history when he met his now-boyfriend Tony in Japan. So he packed up his life and moved overseas — but not without a safety net.

title.children: How love and a career opportunity took Alex to Japan

image.altText: A building with brown designer facade that says Shepparton Law Courts.

props.synopsis: A jury has found a 29-year-old Vanuatu national guilty of the rape and abduction of a woman in Shepparton in August last year.

title.children: Man found guilty of raping woman he found unconscious on nature strip

image.altText: Reece Wlash stands with the Clive Churchill Medal around his neck.

props.synopsis: After setting the NRL and international rugby league alight in recent months, Reece Walsh's next move could be one that leads him to global stardom.

title.children: Broncos icon fears Walsh's star power could mean eventual code switch

image.altText: Will Hayward and Ollie Florent celebrate together

props.synopsis: Will Hayward and Ollie Florent were both locked into long-term deals with Sydney before being told they needed to leave while holidaying in South America.

title.children: 'We want you gone': Ex-Swans hurt by brutal talks before Blues move

image.altText: Packets of Tim Tams and Penguins on a table.

props.synopsis: Food manufacturers are responding to high cocoa prices, and a change to the UK's Penguin biscuit may have all but cemented Australia's Tim Tam as the better of the two.

title.children: UK's rival to the Tim Tam can no longer be called chocolate

image.altText: ANZ logo

props.synopsis: The Australian share market is higher on Friday but still on track for a weekly loss. ANZ has flagged a $1.1 billion profit hit due to redundancy costs and fines.

title.children: ASX on the rise but ANZ shares fall on profit hit — as it happened

image.altText: A young Palestinian boy with bandaged leg and hand in a hospital bed with a woman in black perched next to him.

props.synopsis: Many Palestinians returning to what is left of their homes face the risk of unexploded bombs hidden under rubble, which aid groups say may take decades to clear.

title.children: Children in Gaza mistaking unexploded Israeli bombs for toys

image.altText: Hundreds of men wearing suits and hats crowded in a street and in buildings.

props.synopsis: Hundreds of thousands of ultra-orthodox Jews have shut down one of the busiest junctions at the entrance to Jerusalem in protest against moves to force them to serve in the Israeli military.

title.children: 'We are against its mere existence': Ultra-orthodox Israelis reject country and army service

image.altText: Bouquets and stuffed toys tied to a light pole with police tape around it.

props.synopsis: Police investigating the death of an eight-month-old baby at a Baldivis home charge a 28-year-old woman with murder and say she will face court at a later date.

title.children: Woman in hospital after being charged with baby's murder in Perth's south

image.altText: A carton of imported cigarettes sitting seized in a warehouse

props.synopsis: Two Perth brothers are charged after the seizure of more than four million cigarettes, around 50,500 vapes and almost 900 kilograms of loose-leaf tobacco.

title.children: Millions of illicit cigarettes and vapes seized, Perth brothers charged

image.altText: A life-size bust of Julius Caesar.

props.synopsis: It is time to see if you have been paying attention — test your memory of this week's news cycle here.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: History exams, an unusual gift and the 'storm of the century'

image.altText: People with their fists raised

props.synopsis: Historic legislation has passed that will see the creation of an Indigenous council that will be consulted on laws and policies affecting Indigenous communities.

title.children: Australian-first treaty legislation passes in Victorian parliament

image.altText: a man poses for a photo with his arms over the shoulders of an older woman and a young woman

props.synopsis: On Halloween night in 1936, the tiny, white-haired widow of Harry Houdini made her final attempt to contact him from beyond the grave. Today, the tradition continues.

title.children: Even after the 'final' seance, psychics still try to contact Harry Houdini
